page.title: 19BENHAM VALANCE MANSION
page.content: This mansion was built in 1775 for Lady Craven and her husband, but a computer firm, Norsk Data now own it and 130 acres of parkland around it. They have re-built one wing and restored the rest of the house. There is a linkway between the old house and the modern wing. They have cleared some woodland for car parks and now 75 people work there and another 70 will move from their Strawberry Hill office to join them soon. They are employed in systems integration, which means testing computers before they are sold. The ground floor is now a Grade 1 listed building and has therefore been renovated in the original style. It is the main U.K. Headquarters for this firm which has other offices in Manchester, London, and Edinburgh.
